tweets.text: @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL I am presuming Simon that the ministerial response from Rebecca Pow was pretty much the same as her response to @jogideon in February.  That being, that the government are happy to let the EA and Red Industries carry on exactly as they have always done.  https://t.co/Dy6I7seSHI

@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK Where has this 4610ppm figure come from.  The only reason we ask is that 1000ppm is where it can cause instant death. 

I this figure in the gas wells or something.

These levels of H2S are more typical of a site that has mixed construction and demolition waste, i.e. gypsum containing materials with organic waste.https://t.co/GEou2JZiFn #stopthe stink @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC https://t.co/vJli4tW5Xx

@scottdegg @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @StinkStopthe Been virtually 24/7 last few days, anyone know what urgent action @ClareDinnisEA is taking after her big failure to get clean air on 1/5/21, monitoring until 2026 just will not do #stopthestink

We're excited that the #BeFloodReady south-west Property Flood Resilience (PFR) demonstration centre will be hosted @heartlandsuk. This interactive #PFR space will showcase how you can be prepared for #Flooding. Find out more: https://t.co/J95VO0HCAx
@EnvAgencySW @CornwallCouncil https://t.co/aWwKiQ3DaN

@Feargal_Sharkey @SteveOrmerod @wrurestore @MilesKing10 @LukePollard @Eluned_Morgan @RiverActionUK @theriverstrust @EnvAgency @BBCNews @cathynewman @AfonyddCymru @SalmonTroutCons Add to this that 70% of wetlands have disappeared over the same timeframe. Actions are not only required but are necessary to stop the loss of freshwater biodiversity as a whole.

tweets.text:
üìã SURVEY: WALLEYS QUARRY üìã

We are asking residents to complete a simple questionnaire, on a daily basis, to inform us of the symptoms they are experiencing, as a result of Walleys Quarry. 

More information and the survey can be found at: https://t.co/yTOkAdDkb4 

[@NewsNBC] https://t.co/5WqV37RSzw

Why do we have over-abstracted rivers, regularly maintained by pumps, or filled with sewage?

Because water companies and @EnvAgency use cost-benefit analyses to decide whether new infrastructure should be built or nature should be trashed.

Well guess what...

@DeniseO97662017 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @MattHancock @MPGeorgeEustice @JamesBevanEA @ClareDinnisEA @DefraUKAir @DefraGovUK @BBCPanorama Could the lack of action be because there are no elections coming up?Mat Hancock and the Prime Minister only seem to have paid attention before the vote earlier this month. Sorry - my cynical head is on this morning!
